Articles.Content:
![250px-Constellation_logo_white.svg.png](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/26/Constellation_logo_white.svg/250px-Constellation_logo_white.svg.png)

The Copernicus MTV was to form a key part of the Constellation Program, the link between LEO and Mars. Designed to house astronauts on the way to Mars and back, it was truly an impressive feat of almost-built engineering. I cri evrytiem. Copernicus may never exist in the real world, but you can have it sitting in LKO as soon as you want! (Provided you find a way to get it up there.) Hopefully this replica does it justice.

**Craft Info:** 346 parts, 127 tons, and enough dv for a Duna roundtrip. Only .16 TWR though, be warned.

**Craft Download:** (Mediafire) [\_Copernicus\_MTV.craft"\]Link](http://www./download/x7tz7080wd7xdjm/%5BREPLICA)

And now the beauty shots!

![vPfCEHX.png](http://i.imgur.com/vPfCEHX.png)

![s4X3z7u.png](http://i.imgur.com/s4X3z7u.png)

![mdzGiwP.png](http://i.imgur.com/mdzGiwP.png)

![NUNFcIQ.png](http://i.imgur.com/NUNFcIQ.png)

![1UUP58t.png](http://i.imgur.com/1UUP58t.png)

Thanks for viewing, and leave some rep if you enjoyed!
Great job! What are those fuel tanks made of? They obviously aren't Jumbo 64 tanks.

> 
> Great job! What are those fuel tanks made of? They obviously aren't Jumbo 64 tanks.

Trade secret. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Very nice! Why so few replies? It's driving me crazy not knowing what those fuel tanks are made of! +rep

- - - Updated - - -

It must spread rep around first. Oh well.

WOW that is awesome! Are the tanks made of drills? That is awesome, and the part count is very low for what it is. I would rep you but I still have to spread it around. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I imagine the tanks are made of the new drill parts? Its the only yellow part I can think of ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

What I'm curious about is the perfectly circular solar panels!

Oh god this is awesome, totally blows my old Copernicus Replica.

![DrUCZDj.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/DrUCZDj.jpg)

Can you jettison the center tank once its depleted? I just see a big docking port on it and nothing else arround it

> 
> Oh god this is awesome, totally blows my old Copernicus Replica. Can you jettison the center tank once its depleted? I just see a big docking port on it and nothing else arround it

Thanks! Yeah, the middle tank can be decoupled, not much clearance though. I'm planning to redo this a bit for my Constellation Pack, so it can be sent up in three chunks. And don't put yourself down, that replica looks really nice!

> 
> Oh god this is awesome, totally blows my old Copernicus Replica.
> [http://i.imgur.com/DrUCZDj.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/DrUCZDj.jpg)
> 
> Can you jettison the center tank once its depleted? I just see a big docking port on it and nothing else arround it

It looks good though, very good ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

The middle tanks are not Jumbos, they are a bunch of drill o matics and fuel cells. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Fortunately, it doesn't ruin the delta V that much. Either way great build.

> 
> The middle tanks are not Jumbos, they are a bunch of drill o matics and fuel cells. 
> Fortunately, it doesn't ruin the delta V that much. Either way great build.

Yup, I revealed the trick a while ago. But it doesn't hurt the dv much at all, only the TWR.

> 
> Yup, I revealed the trick a while ago. But it doesn't hurt the dv much at all, only the TWR.

As a matter of fact, I did this to the Delta IV Heavy I am working on. See all them drill o matics ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) Great concept

![QG2u6QA.png](http://i.imgur.com/QG2u6QA.png)
